xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 20 April 2013
xwikidoc.content: <Naman> has joined #ccm 02:16 <UCC> has joined #ccm 02:16 <Naman> @sdumitriu, Thank you for your support, I have the build is now working fine on my Linux machine.. 02:28 <Naman> has left #ccm 02:29 <Naman__> has joined #ccm 03:30 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 06:02 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:07 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:15 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:20 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:29 <camelia_> has joined #ccm 06:50 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 07:06 <camelia_> hello, I work on db lists and I'd like to kindly ask You in a HQL query after having joined the DBStringListProperty as dbprop with the BaseObject as obj , how can I access the list items? I feel that there is one more join needed to get to the xwikilistitems.... 07:08 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, marta hi :) 07:11 <camelia_> should I obtain them using elements(dbprop) ? 07:12 <camelia_> sorry , elements(dbprop.list)? 08:27 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, der ? 08:40 <camelia1789> has joined #ccm 08:44 <sdumitriu> Good morning 08:53 <vevo> has joined #ccm 08:57 <camelia1789> hello, I work on db lists and I'd like to kindly ask You in a HQL query after having joined the DBStringListProperty as dbprop with the BaseObject as obj , how can I access the list items? Is it the elements(dbprop.list) that I should use? 09:00 <sdumitriu> In the from part, use: 09:01 <sdumitriu> DBStringListProperty as dbprop join dbprop.list as propvalue 09:01 <sdumitriu> Now propvalue is a value from the list 09:05 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, Hey 09:05 <sdumitriu> Hey kushalkhandelwal 09:05 <sdumitriu> Still fighting with that bug? 09:06 <kushalkhandelwal> Couldn't give that much of time 09:06 <camelia1789> Thank You! I'll try it this way then. 09:06 <kushalkhandelwal> but still trying to figure it out 09:06 <kushalkhandelwal> Finally over with project submission 09:10 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, 09:22 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:45 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:48 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:53 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:57 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 10:03 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 10:12 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 11:56 <camelia1789> I managed to find smth but I'm not sure it's correct: are the items in omim_id numbers? Like 230350, 300558?? 11:58 <sdumitriu> Yes 11:59 <camelia1789> Great then! And how can they be decoded into strings? 11:59 <camelia1789> I mean their title/ short description? 12:00 <sdumitriu> Where are you looking? What type of object do you have? 12:00 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:01 <camelia1789> I made a query that finds all patients' disorders. Just for testing purposes. And now it's all numbers. 12:01 <sdumitriu> Aha 12:02 <camelia1789> Names and numbers, more precisely 12:02 <camelia1789> names of patients and numbers corresponding to their disorders 12:03 <sdumitriu> Well, the OMIM is indexed in Solr as well 12:03 <sdumitriu> So you'd do: 12:04 <sdumitriu> $services.omim.get('230350') 12:04 <sdumitriu> This gives you the Sorl Document for that OMIM term 12:04 <sdumitriu> And then you can do: 12:04 <camelia1789> I did everything in the Java component 12:04 <sdumitriu> $services.omim.get('230350').name to get the name 12:06 <sdumitriu> Ah, Java 12:06 <sdumitriu> OK 12:06 <sdumitriu> Then you get hold of the OMIM component with 12:08 <sdumitriu> @Inject @Named("omim") private ScriptService omimScriptService; 12:08 <sdumitriu> Unfortunately, you'd have to cast it to (OmimScriptService) 12:09 <sdumitriu> I'm working on improving the Solr components 12:10 <camelia1789> Thank You! I'll try Your suggestion. 12:31 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:36 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:40 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:44 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:48 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:53 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:57 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:04 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:08 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:11 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:15 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:19 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:23 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:28 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:37 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:41 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:48 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 13:53 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:02 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:05 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:16 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:34 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:36 <camelia1789> Thank You, good evening ! 14:38 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:40 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey sdumitriu 14:44 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:48 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:51 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, there ? 14:59 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:03 <sdumitriu> kushalkhandelwal: Yep 15:03 <sdumitriu> Cooking 15:03 <kushalkhandelwal> aahh nice :) 15:06 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:09 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:15 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:18 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:20 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, I am not able to figure it out where it is assering the text box 15:20 <kushalkhandelwal> it is something with displayifnotempty macro 15:20 <kushalkhandelwal> also this is defined twice in the file 15:20 <sdumitriu> What? 15:20 <kushalkhandelwal> That bug 15:21 <kushalkhandelwal> How are we getting that WYSIWYG editor twice 15:21 <kushalkhandelwal> and 15:21 <kushalkhandelwal> #macro (__displayIfNotEmpty $propName) 15:21 <kushalkhandelwal> #end 15:21 <kushalkhandelwal> this is twice in the file 15:23 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:23 <qwebirc36916> has joined #ccm 15:24 <sdumitriu> Hold on 15:26 <kushalkhandelwal> ok 15:28 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:34 <sdumitriu> Back 15:35 <sdumitriu> So 15:36 <sdumitriu> Are you sure that the displayIfNotEmpty macro is defined twice? 15:36 <sdumitriu> I only see it once 16:00 <froggy> has joined #ccm 19:46 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, there ? 19:46 <kushalkhandelwal> sorry slept... .Was so sleepy I slept on my table 19:47 <kushalkhandelwal> ? 19:50 <qwebirc34782> has joined #ccm 19:58 <sdumitriu> Yep 20:01 <sdumitriu> You should rest 20:28 <kushalkhandelwal> Ahh its ok 20:28 <kushalkhandelwal> I want to solve this bug first 20:28 <kushalkhandelwal> I saw that micro twice 20:30 <kushalkhandelwal> line 24 and 53 20:30 <kushalkhandelwal> I migh have made copy whn editing the file 20:32 <kushalkhandelwal> I think I made a cop twice 20:32 <kushalkhandelwal> how do I generate the file without doing a build ? 20:33 <kushalk124> sdumitriu: 20:47 <sdumitriu> kushalk124: Here's a trick 20:47 <sdumitriu> Click on the Administration link on the upper left menu 20:47 <sdumitriu> Then from the drop down menu on the right, select Wiki administration 20:48 <sdumitriu> Click on Import from the left menu 20:48 <sdumitriu> Upload phenotips/resources/ui/target/phenotips-ui-1.0-SNAPSHOT.xar 20:48 <sdumitriu> When it's done, click on the file name 20:48 <sdumitriu> And then you can select which documents to import
